watches.name: Reverso Tribute Tourbillon Platinum / Blue / Alligator
watches.description: The 2018 Jaeger-LeCoultre Reverso Tribute Tourbillon ref. 3926480 is a limited edition of 50 pieces. The case is platinum; the main dial is blue, whilst the one on the reverse is silver.

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

family.name: Reverso
family.description: A long time ago, back in 1931, in a dusty vortex and to the accompaniment of horses’ hooves hammering, an idea was born: a watch with a dial that could protect itself from shocks, all the while offering a personalized engraved background.

caliber.description: Hand-wound movement with flying tourbillon and independently adjustable second time zone plus day-night indicator on the reverse.
caliber.hands: Hours, Minutes, Additional 12 Hour Hand (adjustable), Day / Night Indication

watches.name: Master Ultra Thin Squelette White Gold / Diamond / MOP
watches.description:
Mother-of-pearl and diamonds adorn the intricate labyrinth of the ultra-thin, skeletonized movement. The rare delicacy of the Master Ultra Thin Squelette white gold watch perfectly combines the beauty and precision of Jaeger-LeCoultre's rare handcrafts ("Métiers Rares®") on the same dial. The model is presented in a limited series of 100 pieces.

Reference 1343501 has a Mother of Pearl skeletonised dial and is fitted a black leather strap

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

caliber.description: Skeletonized movement based on the regular 849.

watches.name: Master Ultra Thin Perpetual White Gold / Blue Enamel
watches.description: The Jaeger-LeCoultre Master Ultra Thin Perpetual reference 13035E1 made its debut at SIHH 2019. This limited edition of 100 pieces has a white gold case and a blue hand-enameled guilloché dial.

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

caliber.description: Mechanical automatic winding movement, 332 parts, 28,800 vibrations per hour, 38-hour power-reserve. with perpetual calendar; display for hours, minutes, seconds, year, month, date, day, moonphase.
caliber.date: Date, Day, Month, Year Indicator, Perpetual Calendar

watches.name: Master Grande Tradition Quantième Perpétuel 8 Jours SQ Green
watches.description:
The Master Grande Tradition Quantième Perpétuel 8 jours SQ watch demonstrates all Jaeger-LeCoultre's mastery of Rare Crafts such as skeletonising, engraving and enamelling. This watch's skeleton movement is cut away and decorated entirely by hand. In order to enhance the dial, its rim is decorated with guilloché work and covered with translucent enamel. A truly exceptional timepiece, it is also the only perpetual calendar watch with an 8-day power reserve. Its perpetual calendar functions are mechanically programmed until the year 2100, and are all activated by a single date-corrector.

Reference 5063540 was introduced at SIHH 2016. It features a green enameled outer ring on its dial.

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

caliber.description: Hand-wound movement with perpetual calendar; skeletonized; power reserve of 8 days.
caliber.date: Date, Day, Month, Year Indicator, Perpetual Calendar

watches.name: Master Grande Tradition Gyrotourbillon Westminster Perpetual White Gold / Blue
watches.description:
The Jaeger-LeCoultre Master Grande Tradition Gyrotourbillon Westminster Perpetual was introduced in 2019. It features a constant forcegGyrotourbillon, a minute repeater with a Westminster chime that reproduces four melodies on the wrist, and a perpetual calendar that can be adjusted both forward as well as backwards. The case measures 43mm across at a height of 14mm.

Reference 52534E1 has a white gold case and a blue enamel guilloché dial.

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

caliber.description:
Hand-wound movement with perpetual calendar, minute repeater and spherical gyro-tourbillon. The tourbillon is significantly smaller than those in the preceding Gyrotourbillon timepieces. It uses four sets of gongs and hammers to create the Westminster chime to indicate the quarters when the minute repeater is activated, incorporating a complex mechanism that places it at the most prestigious tier of chiming watches and has a silence-reduction function built into its chiming mechanism. This ensures that even when the full set of Westminster quarters is not struck, there is no time delay corresponding to the missing quarters before the minutes are struck. 

A one-minute constant-force mechanism provides a consistent level of power for the energy-hungry tourbillon without affecting its chronometric ability. The constant-force mechanism consists of a spring, known classically as a remontoir d’égalité, that is periodically re-armed by the mainspring and acts as a secondary power source to protect the regulating organ of the movement. This regulates the motion of the minute wheel, creating a jumping minutes hand that offers greater precision in time display. More significantly, the mechanism that controls the minute strike also follows this one-minute jumping system, which completely eliminates the chiming error that can occur when the repeater is activated between minutes, when the chime played and the time shown can be one minute apart.

The most common configuration of the perpetual calendar mechanism can only be adjusted in one direction, but the Master Grande Tradition Gyrotourbillon Westminster Perpétuel emphasises the experience and convenience of the user, and its date can be adjusted forwards or backwards without harming the movement. The pointer-style date indication further reinforces the precision aspect of the timepiece, as it jumps over the tourbillon aperture in order to provide the best possible view of the visually stunning rotating escapement.
caliber.date: Date, Leap Year, Month, Year Indicator

watches.name: Royal Oak OffShore 26582 Grande Complication Black Ceramic
watches.description: The Royal Oak Offshore 26582CE.OO.A002CA.01 was introduced in 2018. It features a black ceramic case paired with an openworked dial. It is powered by caliber 2885, which features a minute repeater, split-seconds chronograph, perpetual calendar, moonphase, and hours, minutes & small seconds.

caliber.description:
Fourteen lignes in diameter (31.60 mm) and 8.55 mm thick, this self-winding mechanical watch is endowed with a split-seconds chronograph, a minute repeater and a perpetual calendar with moon-phase functions. 

The prestigious " Grande Complication " designation is bestowed upon a watch that possesses at least four different functions out of these three categories. It takes great mastery to create a timepiece offering excellence in every department: design and reliability, as well as precision. The Calibre 2885 by the Manufacture Audemars Piguet is a case in point.

watches.name: Royal Oak Extra-Thin Stainless Steel / Dark Blue
watches.description:
The Royal Oak 'Extra-Thin' is Audemars Piguet modern Jumbo - the design closely following the original lines as introduced with the 1972 5402. The case measures 39mm across and houses the tried & tested caliber 2121 movement.

Reference 15202ST.OO.0944ST.02 has a stainless steel case with matching bracelet and a dark blue 'Grande Tapisserie' dial.

caliber.description: Slim (3.05mm) self-winding movement, originally created by Jaeger-LeCoultre and used by Audemars Piguet, Vacheron Constantin and Patek Philippe.

watches.name: Royal Oak Ultra Thin Tourbillon Stainless Steel / Plum Evolutive
watches.description:
Introduced in 2012, the Royal Oak Ultra Thin Tourbillon pairs the classic Royal Oak aesthetics with a hand-wound movement with tourbillon escapement. It is the first Royal Oak with no additional complications to be fitted with such a highly-valued escapement - earlier versions like the 1997 limited, the 1999 Tradition d'Excellence and the later Chrono Tourbillon and Concept watches all featured additional functions.

Reference 26522ST.OO.1220ST.01 was added to the collection in 2018. It features a stainless steel case and a plum dial with sunburst "Tapisserie Evolutive" pattern.

caliber.description: In-house Audemars Piguet movement with tourbillon escapement and indicator for the 70 hours power reserve on the back.

watches.name: Royal Oak Concept 26577 Supersonnerie
watches.description:
The Royal Oak 26577TI.OO.D002CA.01 is the production version of the RD#1. A total of three patents, two for the moment and one for the case construction, ensures that the quality of the sound coming from the minute repeater is unequaled. 

The case of the Supersonnerie is made of titanium; the crown and pushpieces are made of black ceramics. The caseback features apertures and a second [inner] copper shield to enhance the sound.

caliber.description: Hand-wound movement with minute repeater, tourbillon escapement and chronograph with 30-minute counter. Introduced in 2016 as an attempt to enhance the quality of the sound of the repeater, both in terms of tone as well as loudness and interval.

watches.name: CODE 11.59 Selfwinding Flying Tourbillon Chronograph Pink Gold / Ceramic
watches.description:
The Audemars Piguet CODE 11.59 collection was introduced at SIHH 2019. Available in a number of configurations, all of the watches in this line feature a distinct case design with an octagonal mid-case sandwiched between a round top and back, paired with hollowed-out lugs.

The Code 11.59 reference [WATCH_REF} was added to the collection in 2022. This limited edition of 50 pieces has a ceramic case with pink gold bezel, case back and lugs, which houses the self-winding, open-worked caliber AP 2952 with flying tourbillon and chronograph.

caliber.description: Self-winding movement with flying tourbillon and fly-back chronograph.

watches.name: Royal Oak OffShore 67543 Lady Quartz Sapphire Hour
watches.description:
The Royal Oak Offshore 67543 is a heavily diamond-set version of AP's iconic sports watch. Its white gold case measures 37mm across and houses the quartz caliber 2716.

Reference 67543BC.ZZ.D606CR.01 has 145 baguette-cut diamonds on its case and buckle and 146 baguette-cut diamonds on its dial. Twelve baguette-cut pink sapphires function as hour markers.

caliber.description: Quartz movement with display for hours, minutes and date. Finished with Cotes de Geneve.

watches.name: Royal Oak OffShore 26113 Lady Chronograph Suade
watches.description: The Royal Oak Offshore 26113SR is a limited edition of 100 pieces introduced in 2009. It features a stainless steel case with pink gold details.

caliber.description: Self-winding movement with integrated column-wheel operated chronograph mechanism with date.

watches.name: Royal Oak OffShore 26144 Lady Chronograph Stainless Steel / Silver / Diamond / Summer Edition 2017
watches.description: The Royal Oak Offshore reference 26144ST.ZZ.D010CA.01 was introduced in 2018 as a limited "summer' edition of 200 pieces. It features a stainless steel case with diamond-set bezel, and a silver dial with "Lady Tapisserie" pattern.

caliber.description: Self-winding movement with integrated column-wheel operated chronograph mechanism with date.

watches.name: Royal Oak OffShore 26231 Lady Chronograph Stainless Steel / Pink / Diamond
watches.description:
The Royal Oak Offshore 26231 is a smaller-sized Offshore Chronograph with diamond-set bezel. The case measures 37mm, housing the self-winding caliber 2385 movement. The dial features the signature 'Tapisserie' pattern in 'Lady' version.

Reference 26231ST.ZZ.D069CA.01 was added to the collection in 2018. It features a deep pink dial and matching rubber strap.

caliber.description: Self-winding movement with integrated column-wheel operated chronograph mechanism with date.

watches.name: Royal Oak OffShore 26231 Lady Chronograph Yellow Gold - Sapphire / Blue
watches.description:
The Royal Oak Offshore 26231 is a smaller-sized Offshore Chronograph with diamond-set bezel. The case measures 37mm across at a height of approx. 11.8mm, housing the self-winding caliber 2385 movement. The dial features the signature 'Tapisserie' pattern in 'Lady' version.

Reference [WATCH__REF] has a Yellow Gold case with a bezel set with yellow, green and blue baguette-cut sapphires, and a Blue dial. This model was added to the collection in 2023.

caliber.description: Self-winding movement with integrated column-wheel operated chronograph mechanism with date.

watches.name: Reverso One Duetto Moon Pink Gold / Silver / Alligator
watches.description:
It is equipped with the Duetto concept: operated by a single mechanical movement, two back-to-back dials give the watch two different personalities. Its back face features a moon phase display with the moon in mother-of-pearl.

Launched at SIHH 2016.
Case size 40.1x20mm

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

caliber.description: Hand-wound movement displaying hours & minutes on both front & back (identical). Moonphase on back. 129 components.

watches.name: Reverso One Duetto Stainless Steel / Silver /  Bracelet
watches.description: The Jaeger-LeCoultre Reverso Duetto 3348120 has a stainless steel case with two rows of brilliant-cut diamonds. One dial is silver while the other is blue.

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

family.name: Reverso
family.description: A long time ago, back in 1931, in a dusty vortex and to the accompaniment of horses’ hooves hammering, an idea was born: a watch with a dial that could protect itself from shocks, all the while offering a personalized engraved background.

caliber.description: Hand-wound movement with display for hours & minutes on both front & back (identical).

watches.name: Rendez-Vous Sonatina Large White Gold / Diamond / Blue
watches.description: The Jaeger-LeCoultre Rendez-Vous Sonatina 3592420 was introduced at SIHH 2017. It features a white gold, diamond-set case and a blue dial. It is powered by the self-winding caliber 735.

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

family.name: Rendez-Vous
family.description: For delicate and refined women, Jaeger-LeCoultre created the Rendez-Vous line. Gracefully rounded, designed in pure Art Deco style, it accompanies elegant ladies around the clock. Diamond gem- setting lends the ultimate touch of sophistication to this unusual collection.

caliber.description: Self-winding movement with display for hours, minutes, day/night indicator, and a alarm that strikes a single note every time the minute hand passes a set time - also known as a sonnerie en passant.
caliber.hands: Hours, Minutes, Day / Night Indication, Small Seconds

watches.name: Rendez-Vous Dazzling Moon White Gold / MOP / Alligator
watches.description: The Jaeger-LeCoultre Rendez-Vous Jewelry ref. 3523570 was introduced in 2019. It features a white gold case of 36mm with diamond-set lugs and bezel.

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

caliber.description:
Mechanical automatic winding movement, 242 parts, 28,800 vibrations per hour, 38-hour power-reserve.
Indications for hour, minute, central seconds, moon phases.

watches.name: Rendez-Vous Moon Medium Stainless Steel - Diamond / Silver
watches.description: The jaeger-LeCoultre Rendez-Vous Moon reference 3578430 has a stainless steel case with diamond-set bezel, which houses the self-winding caliber 925A/1. The dial is silver.

brand.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre
brand.description: It was an invention that led to the first Jaeger-LeCoultre workshop. Since 1833, the Manufacture has not only fostered this heritage of invention, creativity and technical skill together under one roof but also constantly set out in search of innovation.

family.description: For delicate and refined women, Jaeger-LeCoultre created the Rendez-Vous line. Gracefully rounded, designed in pure Art Deco style, it accompanies elegant ladies around the clock. Diamond gem- setting lends the ultimate touch of sophistication to this unusual collection.

caliber.description:
Mechanical automatic winding movement, 242 parts, 28,800 vibrations per hour, 38-hour power-reserve.
Indications for hour, minute, central seconds, moon phases.

watches.name: Symphonette S Stainless Steel / Rose Gold / Diamond
watches.description: The Longines L2.305.5.87.7 has a stainless steel case of 18.9*28.4mm, which is crowned by a pink gold crown. It is fitted with a stainless steel bracelet with partial pink gold capping.

caliber.description: Longines adaptation of ETA 280.002

watches.name: Grandmaster Chime 5175
watches.description:
The star of Patek Phillipe's highly anticipated 175th anniversary collection.

The Grandmaster Chime is sans doubt Patek's most impressive feat of modern times. It features an array of functions housed in a massive 47.4 * 16.1mm rose gold case made up of 214 components, while its movement consists of no less than 1.366 parts.

The traditional grand complication watch can be described as having one acoustic complication, one time measurement complication and one calendar complication - of course preferably all as complicated as possible. Patek Philippe however choose to go its own way and create a watch that's based upon the former and the latter, while doing away with the chronographic bits. By no means a short-cut though: the Grandmaster Chime still features 20 complications, among which two that have never been seen before.

The first novelty is the Date Repeater - and this one we actually had to add to our WatchBase list of complications. The pusher at 4 o'clock will chime the date at the owners request, with a double chime (ding-dong) for each ten and a single chime for each single digit: 26 would be two double chimes and six single chimes.

The second novelty is found in the alarm function. Instead of a buzz, the alarm will chime the hours at which it is set just like the minute repeater - with a built in feature making sure it doesn't chime just once if the alarm is set at say 1:00.

The Grandmaster Chime too features Patek's first Petite and Grande Sonnerie, chiming the time 'en passant'. The power reserve for the Sonnerie is set at an impressive 30 hours, which alone is no small feat. All chiming functions share the same barrel, whose power reserve is displayed separately from that of the timekeeping.

The case is a baroque work of art, lavishly decorated with engraved leaves - an acquired taste or a testament to the museum-worth quality of this watch?

The total of 20 complication is displayed over two dials, with the back dedicated to the perpetual calendar - though of course the 'simple' date display on the front is hooked up to the same perpetual mechanism.

A total of seven pieces are made, with one being destined to a life in the Patek Philippe Museum. Price is set at 2.5 million CHF.

brand.name: Patek Philippe
brand.description: Patek Philippe has been perpetuating the tradition of Genevan watchmaking without interruption since May 1, 1839. As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). Thanks to its exceptional know-how, Patek Philippe maintains a tradition of innovation hailed by an impressive repertoire of more than 80 patents.

family.name: Grand Complications
family.description: The Grand Complications family of Patek Philippe consists of some of the best and most complicated watches out there. Perpetual Calendars, Split Second Chronographs, Minute Repeater and many others - if not combined in one single masterpiece: Patek Philippe masters all horological complications.

caliber.description: Patek's masterpiece movement that took an alleged 8 years of development. A total of 1.366 parts is working in perfect harmony to keep their most complicated wristwatch yet operating. It's functions include a Grande Sonnerie, Petite Sonnerie and minute repeater, a strikework mode display for the sonnerie (Silence/ Grande Sonnerie/Petite Sonnerie), an alarm with time strike, a never-before-seen date repeater, a power-reserve indicator for the movement as well as for the strikework, a strikework isolator indicator, a second time zone plus a day/night indicator for it, an instantaneous jumping perpetual calendar with display of day and month, date display (both front and back), leap year cycle and a four-digit year display, a moon phase display, a 24-hour and minute subdial, and a crown position indicator (winding [R], alarm setting [A], timesetting [H]). They are displayed through dials on both front as well as the back of the movement.
caliber.acoustic: Alarm, Date Repeater, Grande Sonnerie, Minute Repeater, Petite Sonnerie
caliber.date: Date, Day, Leap Year, Month, Perpetual Calendar, Year Indicator
caliber.hands: Additional 24 Hour Hand (adjustable), Day / Night Indication, Hours, Minutes, Small Seconds

watches.name: Minute Repeater 7000 Rose Gold / Bird
watches.description: Ladies’ minute-repeater wristwatch with dial in cloisonné enamel over hand-executed guilloché work. The first minute-repeater wristwatch for women to feature a dial in Grand Feu cloisonné enamel, this haute horlogerie model decorated with rare handcrafts gives center stage to a bird pecking red berries. First, the yellow-gold dial plate was hand-guilloched with a fine panier or basket-weave pattern. Next, the enameler outlined the graceful picture of the bird with outspread wings and the branch, using 58 cm of gold wire (0.32 g) measuring 0.07 x 0.4 mm in cross-section. He then brought the scene to life with a palette of transparent, opaque and opalescent enamels in 21 colors. Each dial required 10 firings at a temperature of approximately 750°C. The rose-gold Calatrava-style case houses the caliber R 27 self-winding movement with minute repeater striking on two gongs. This movement, comprising 342 parts, is visible through a sapphire-crystal case back. The watch also comes with an interchangeable back in solid rose gold.

brand.name: Patek Philippe
brand.description: Patek Philippe has been perpetuating the tradition of Genevan watchmaking without interruption since May 1, 1839. As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). Thanks to its exceptional know-how, Patek Philippe maintains a tradition of innovation hailed by an impressive repertoire of more than 80 patents.

family.name: Grand Complications
family.description: The Grand Complications family of Patek Philippe consists of some of the best and most complicated watches out there. Perpetual Calendars, Split Second Chronographs, Minute Repeater and many others - if not combined in one single masterpiece: Patek Philippe masters all horological complications.

caliber.description: Minute repeater with classic gongs. Diameter: 28 mm. Height: 5.05 mm. Parts: 342. Bridges: 10. Jewels: 39. Power reserve: Min. 43 hours - max. 48 hours. 22K gold off-center mini-rotor. Balance: Gyromax®. Vibrations/hour: 21 600 (3 Hz). Balance spring: Spiromax®. Hallmark: Patek Philippe Seal.

watches.name: Pocket Watch Lepine Yellow Gold / Napa Valley
watches.description: The Patek Philippe 992/111G is part of a series of unique pieces made in honor of the 2017 Art of Watches Grand Exhibition in New York, paying tribute to the history, culture and nature of the USA. This particular example features a view of Napa Valley on its case back done using a combination of miniature painting on enamel and hand-engraving.

brand.name: Patek Philippe
brand.description: Patek Philippe has been perpetuating the tradition of Genevan watchmaking without interruption since May 1, 1839. As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). Thanks to its exceptional know-how, Patek Philippe maintains a tradition of innovation hailed by an impressive repertoire of more than 80 patents.

caliber.description: Hand-wound lepine movement. Diameter of 38.65mm at a height of 3.8mm. Total of 137 parts including 7 bridges and 18 jewels.

watches.name: Heritage 1918 Lady
watches.description: As a tribute to its long watchmaking tradition, the Swiss brand Longines loves to reissue some of the iconic pieces that have enhanced its profile throughout its existence. This 1918 model draws its inspiration from the rich history of the brand with the winged hourglass and echoes the first bracelet-chronographs created by Longines. As with the latter, this timepiece features a dial also found on pocket watches from this period. Its vintage aesthetic and refined fabrication will entice both male and female admirers of fine watchmaking.

caliber.description: Longines version of ETA 2895, automatic movement with small seconds and date.

watches.name: PrimaLuna Quartz 23 Two Tone Pink Diamond MOP
watches.description: The Longines PrimaLuna is an elegant ladies watch with soft, round lines that gently hug the wrist. Available in a wide array of variations, the present L8.109 model features a 23mm case and a quartz movement (caliber L963). As reference L8.109.5.89.6, the PrimaLuna has a stainless steel with (pink) gold capped bits and a matching bracelet. The solid gold bezel is diamond-set, as is the mother-of-pearl dial.

family.name: PrimaLuna
family.description: In an age of ever-growing watch sizes and women wearing men's watches rather regularly, the Longines PrimaLuna is refreshingly elegant. Its case size never exceeds 34mm, it is available with a choice of dials and in a choice of materials. All of them share the rounded, delicate case that is graceful and sophisticated.

caliber.description: Longines adaptation of ETA 280.002

watches.name: Symphonette L Diamond / Black / Bracelet
watches.description:
The Longines Symphonette is an oval-shaped ladies wristwatch launched in 2015. It is available in four sizes: S (16*25mm), M (18.9*29.4mm), L (21.9*34mm), and XL (23.9*38.6mm).

Reference L2.306.0.57.6 has a stainless steel case with diamond-set bezel and a matching black dial. It is fitted with a stainless steel bracelet.

caliber.description: Quartz movement based on ETA Normflatline 980.163.

watches.name: Symphonette XL Diamond / Black
watches.description:
The Longines Symphonette is an oval-shaped ladies wristwatch launched in 2015. It is available in four sizes: S (16*25mm), M (18.9*29.4mm), L (21.9*34mm), and XL (23.9*38.6mm).

Reference L2.307.0.57.0 has a stainless steel case (XL) with diamond-set bezel and a black dial.

caliber.description: Quartz movement based on ETA Normflatline 980.163.

watches.name: DolceVita 17.4 Quartz Stainless Steel / Silver
watches.description: The DolceVita is Longines' interpretation of the classic rectangular 'tank' design. It is available in a wide variation of configurations; the present model has a stainless steel case of 17.4*27mm, housing a quartz movement.

caliber.description: Longines adaptation of ETA 280.002

watches.name: DolceVita 23 Quartz Pink Gold Gold / Elegance Celebration
watches.description: The Longines DolceVita {WATCH_REF] has a pink gold case of 20.3*37mm, which houses a quartz movement with smalls seconds. The dial is Multi-Color mother-of-pearl, cutout on a turqoise base.

caliber.description: Quartz movement based on ETA Normflatline 980.163.

watches.name: Pocket Watch Samurai Woman / Tokyo 2023
watches.description: The Patek Philippe Pocket Watch 995/132J is a unique piece created for the 2023 Patek Philippe exhibition. This pocket watch displays several 'rare handcrafts' techniques; wood marquetry and enameling. This unique piece with a back in wood marquetry shines the spotlight on one of the rare onna-bugeisha or female samurai to influence the course of Japanese history by her courage and prowess. To render all the finesse of the facial expression and the wealth of detail displayed in the armor, the marquetry maker cut out and assembled 517 tiny veneer parts and 90 inlays, together spanning a palette of 36 species of wood in different colors, textures and veining.

brand.name: Patek Philippe
brand.description: Patek Philippe has been perpetuating the tradition of Genevan watchmaking without interruption since May 1, 1839. As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). Thanks to its exceptional know-how, Patek Philippe maintains a tradition of innovation hailed by an impressive repertoire of more than 80 patents.

caliber.description: Hand-wound lepine movement. Diameter of 38.65mm at a height of 3.8mm. Total of 137 parts including 7 bridges and 18 jewels.

watches.name: Minute Repeater 5079 Pragnell
watches.description: The Patek 5079 was introduced in 2004 as a limited edition of 10 pieces celebrating the 50th anniversary of George Pragnell LTD, a UK based Patek Philippe dealer.

brand.name: Patek Philippe
brand.description: Patek Philippe has been perpetuating the tradition of Genevan watchmaking without interruption since May 1, 1839. As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). Thanks to its exceptional know-how, Patek Philippe maintains a tradition of innovation hailed by an impressive repertoire of more than 80 patents.

family.name: Grand Complications
family.description: The Grand Complications family of Patek Philippe consists of some of the best and most complicated watches out there. Perpetual Calendars, Split Second Chronographs, Minute Repeater and many others - if not combined in one single masterpiece: Patek Philippe masters all horological complications.

caliber.description: Micro-rotor automatic movement with minute repeater function.

watches.name: World Time 5130
watches.description: The Worldtimer 5130/1R-011 has both a rose gold case as well as bracelet, which are paired with a superb brown dial. This configuration was discontinued in 2016.

brand.name: Patek Philippe
brand.description: Patek Philippe has been perpetuating the tradition of Genevan watchmaking without interruption since May 1, 1839. As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). Thanks to its exceptional know-how, Patek Philippe maintains a tradition of innovation hailed by an impressive repertoire of more than 80 patents.

family.name: Complications
family.description: A 'complication' in watchmaking is anything a mechanical watch might do beyond telling the time and simple date. Patek Philippe upholds a tradition in complications that are useful in everyday situations, such as Annual Calendars, dual time zones and World Time displays. At Patek Philippe, they enjoy unrivalled expertise in our knowledge and practice of this pinnacle of the watchmaker's art.

caliber.hands: Hours, Minutes, World Time, Day / Night Indication

watches.name: Perpetual Calendar 3448
watches.description:
The Patek Philippe Perpetual Calendar 3448 marked an important milestone: when introduced in 1962, it was the first self-winding watch by any brand to feature a perpetual calendar mechanism. It would remain in the collection until the early-mid eighties, when it first was accompanied by the 3450 with leap year indicator (though 3448's with such feature exist too) and later both were replaced by the 3940.

A total of 586 are said to have been made, with most being cased in yellow gold. Other precious metals -rose, white and platinum- have also appeared on the marked and command a hefty premium over the already steep price of this collectors favorite.

The present example, as sold by Antiquorum, is furthermore distinguished by its Cartier signed dial. It was made in 1968.

As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). caliber.description: The first self-winding perpetual calendar wristwatch movement. Based on 27-460 automatic movement. Introduced ca. 1962; later improved with indication for leap year in caliber 27-460 QB.

watches.name: Perpetual Calendar 3448
watches.description:
The Patek Philippe 3448 was a milestone watch: it was the first automatic perpetual calendar wristwatch to ever appear on the market. It was first introduced in 1962. In the early eighties it was accompanied by the 3450, which included a leap year indicator. In 1985 the 3940 was introduced, more or less replacing both.

The present example, as appeared in an Antiquorum auction, features an integrated bracelet exemplary of the late 70's style - it was manufactured in 1978.

watches.name: Perpetual Calendar 3448
watches.description:
The Patek Philippe Perpetual Calendar 3448 was, thanks to its 27-460Q movement, the very first automatic perpetual calendar to appear on the market. A total of 586 examples are said to have been made.

The present example has a yellow gold case and a silver dial. Its dial is double signed with the retailers signature - 'Howes'. It was sold by Antiquorum and manufactured in 1977.

brand.name: Patek Philippe

As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). watches.name: Perpetual Calendar 3448
watches.description:
The 3448 is one of Patek's most coveted references. It was the first self-winding perpetual calendar to be made - not just by Patek, but by any manufacturer. It is said a little under 600 examples were made, including a few without moonphase and an exceedingly small number of transitional models featuring the leap year indicator as later found on the ref. 3450.

The present example was manufactured in 1972 and later sold by Antiquorum.

watches.name: Calatrava 5088 Volutes & Arabesques
watches.description:
Patek Philippe Calatrava 5088 is introduced in 2015 as a limited edition of 10 pieces.

Calatrava wristwatch with hand-engraved and enameled dial. The clean, understated lines of this platinum Calatrava are the perfect foil for a dial that has exuberant decoration evoking the most exquisite medieval illuminations. The ornamentation alone required more than 30 hours of consummate artistry. Only when the scrollwork was flawless could the engraver intervene to enrich it with the details of emblematic leaves and the fluid, tendril-like curves of arabesques. The caseband is also fluted with enamel volutes. A sapphire crystal caseback reveals the ultra-slim self-winding caliber 240. A platinum prong buckle with hand-engraved decoration fastens the alligator strap.

brand.name: Patek Philippe
brand.description: Patek Philippe has been perpetuating the tradition of Genevan watchmaking without interruption since May 1, 1839. As the last family-owned independent watch manufacturer in Geneva, it enjoys total creative freedom to entirely design, produce and assemble what experts agree to be the finest timepieces in the world – following the vision of its founders Antoine Norbert de Patek (1839) and Adrien Philippe (1845). Thanks to its exceptional know-how, Patek Philippe maintains a tradition of innovation hailed by an impressive repertoire of more than 80 patents.

family.name: Calatrava
family.description: Created in 1932, it is the result of an avant-garde philosophy of aesthetics that showcases sleek lines and subtle elegance; the collection expresses artistic ingenuity at its very finest. The endearing quality of the design reflects the relentless pursuit of perfection that has always been at the core of Patek Philippe's mission.

watches.name: Calatrava 5077 Royal Tigers
watches.description:
5077P-066

Calatrava wristwatch with marquetry dials. 

Dial decorated with a tiger’s head in precious wood marquetry. Each dial required 50 hours of work by a master marquetarian, using 120 different pieces from 8 types of wood. White gold Dauphine hands. 12 diamond hour markers. Alligator strap with pin buckle. Platinum. Diameter: 38 mm. Caliber 240, ultra-thin self-winding movement. Sapphire crystal caseback. Limited edition (2011).

brand.name: Patek Philippe
brand.description: Patek Philippe has been perpetuating the tradition of Genevan watchmaking without interruption since May 1, 1839. watches.name: Calatrava 5077R Pictures in Relief / Floral Scrolls
watches.description:
Calatrava wristwatch with dial decorated with hand-executed guilloché work and gold applied ornaments. 

The decoration on the dial of this limited edition combines a pattern of vertical waves, hand-guilloched in the rose gold and coated in pale pink lacquer, with rose-gold applied ornaments in the shape of floral scrolls.

Crafted by hand and fixed to the surface, the scrolls become part of a true picture in relief with its play of light and shade. A hand-engraved arabesque motif adorns the rose-gold Dauphine hands. Twelve diamonds (~0.06 ct) set in rose-gold chatons form the hour circle. The bezel and lugs are set with 113 brilliant-cut Top Wesselton Pure diamonds (~0.8 ct) and the buckle sparkles with 29 diamonds (~0.22 ct). Crafted by hand and fixed to the surface, the scrolls become part of a true picture in relief with its play of light and shade. A hand-engraved arabesque motif adorns the rose-gold Dauphine hands. Twelve diamonds (~0.06 ct) set in rose-gold chatons form the hour circle. The bezel and lugs are set with 113 brilliant-cut Top Wesselton Pure diamonds (~0.8 ct) and the buckle sparkles with 29 diamonds (~0.22 ct).

Housed in a rose-gold case, the caliber 240 ultra-thin self-winding movement may be admired through the sapphire-crystal back.
